result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul Jason Bergeman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With credit for 48 DAYS time served.

miscConds.notes:
Pay supervision fees.
Provide a DNA sample - pay surcharge.
Pay all remaining costs, surcharges and assessments, including the DV surcharge, bail to apply, if any, remaining costs and surcharges are to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
The Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may not vote until his/her civil rights are restored and he/she may never possess a firearm.
Defendant to have a mental health evaluation and cooperate with any treatment.
No contact with victim.  No other modification without the approval of the court.

Obtain an AODA assessment and follow-up treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens - no illegal drugs.

timeConds.notes:
05-20-2016/ Judge Jeffrey A Kremers
The Court ordered that the HOC condition time stayed to today's date be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.  
The Court waived the remaining costs & surcharges.  
Defendant does have to pay Supervision fees.   
**  **  **  **  **  **  **  **  **  **  

60 days are to be served FORTHWITH.  Defendant may have work detail privileges only, 60 days are stayed until the review hearing on March 18, 2016.

records.addlTxt: Original PLEA/SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (25 pages) commencing DECEMBER 17, 2015 received and filed.
reflects 05-20-16 Court order staying condition time and waiving costs.

Defendant Paul Jason Bergeman in court.  Micha A. Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.
Because the defendant is doing so well, the court waived the remaining costs and surcharges.  Defendant does have to pay the supervision fees.

The defendant was just released from custody and the agent is requesting a new review date at a later time.
Case adjourned for 05/20/2016 at 01:30 p.m.
cab

Defendant Paul Jason Bergeman in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Defendant Paul Jason Bergeman in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
As to count 2: 
  Defendant waived  rights and pled guilty.
Guilty Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights and Elements of Criminal Offenses - Felonies received and filed.
Defendant examined as to his plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Judgment of Conviction entered.
As to count 1:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered count 1 dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
.
Sentencing continued...
.
   Statements as to sentencing by state and defense. Victim statement filed.
As to count 2:
  Statements made as to sentencing.  Additional statement/s by:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 27 MONTHS, with credit for 48 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 14  MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 13 MONTHS. 
The Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 2 YEARS with the following conditions:
*   As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 120 days, 60 day are to be served FORTHWITH.  Defendant may have work detail privileges only, 60 days are stayed until the review hearing.
*   Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
*   Obtain an AODA assessment and follow-up treatment;
*   Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens - no illegal drugs; 
*   No contact with victim.  No other modification without the approval of the court.  
*   Defendant to have a mental health evaluation and cooperate with any treatment.
*   Obtain/maintain employment; 
*   Pay supervision fees;
*   Provide a DNA sample - pay surcharge;
*   Pay all remaining costs, surcharges and assessments, including the DV surcharge,  bail to apply, if any, remaining costs and surcharges are to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Earned Release Program.
The Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may not vote until his/her civil rights are restored and he/she may never possess a firearm.
Filed Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Case adjourned for a probation review hearing in Branch 36.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for March 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Justice Point report received and filed.
Defendant appeared this morning but left the court and did not return.
  Defendant failing to appear, the Court ordered a bench warrant to issue.  The Court ordered cash bond/signature bond forfeited.  The Court ordered Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office. If the defendant appears back in court within 24 hours, the court will withdraw the warrant and reinstate the bail.

Defendant Paul Jason Bergeman in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to a branch of the Circuit Court to be determined. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Court advised parties that all discovery must be turned over, all witness lists and motions filed 20 DAYS in advance of the Jury Trial date. All conditions of bail remain in effect.
